newsitem.title: PAKISTAN: Pakistani stocks end down on adverse power news.
newsitem.headline: Pakistani stocks end down on adverse power news.

text.p: Pakistani stocks ended down on Thursday on adverse news that the government was planning to renegotiate the tariff for buying electricity from private firms, dealers said.

The Karachi Stock Exchange (KSE) 100-share index ended 47.50 points, or 2.90 percent, down at 1,588.05 amid 263 losers and 50 gainers. Turnover rose to 58.7 million shares from Wednesday's 57.4 million.
"This news was the key factor that dragged down the energy sector prices and dampened overall sentiment," one dealer said. But he said the market over-reacted in the absence of details.
The index fell through the 1,600-point psychological barrier and there is a possibility that it may fall further, broker Majid Chapra said.
HUBCO fell 1.75 rupees to 37.75, PTCL 1.00 to 29.80, Lever Brothers 32 to 705, ICI 1.15 to 24.60, Dewan Salman Fibre 1.70 to 40.80, PSO 8.00 to 302 and Fauji Cement 0.50 to 10.30.
